poem:
**Questions for Simon Neil**

From Blackened Sky to arena reach,  
The strings turn math to brawn—  
A decade thrums beneath their feet  
And echoes to the dawn.  
With twin heartbeats backing chords,  
Their sound—a rising sea,  
We ask, as fans upon the shore,  
What fills Futique's decree?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Post your questions for Biffy Clyro frontman Simon Neil After a remarkable rise from cult math-emo band to brawny arena-filling rockers, Biffy Clyro reach the 10-album milestone with their next release, Futique. Ahead of it coming out on 19 September, frontman Simon Neil will take on your questions. With Neil on vocals and guitars backed by twin brother rhythm section of James and Ben Johnston, the trio released their debut album Blackened Sky back in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
